name: HD 15337
scenarioDescription:
The HD 15337 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 15337 is a star with 0.9 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.86 times its radius. It is located 146.35 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 5.1 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 15337 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 15337 system


HD 15337 b

HD 15337 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 15337 b is 7.514340000000001 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 15337 b is 1.64 that of Earth. At 7.514340000000001 Earth masses, HD 15337 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


HD 15337 c

HD 15337 c was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 15337 c is 8.11536 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 15337 c is 2.39 that of Earth. At 8.11536 Earth masses, HD 15337 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 15337, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
